comments.body:
Alright @smallfind I did just that and changed the master file around the now existing dcl identifiers.

So the three copies of Christianarum antiquitatum are: 
dcl:096 = fiche header: 3215(3)
dcl:337 = fiche header: [fiched as] 3247  = VI M 3(3)
dcl:p02 = fiche header: 3247(1)

and the Bellezze di Verona is now dcl:092.

Hurts my sould but should now hopefully work out.

This means I also had to adjust the NEW DCL Numbers file and have reuploaded into the Google Drive.

Cheers!

master file excerpt for completeness: 

Cico-Nr. | Double   Number | Author | Title | Place | Year | Vatican   call no. | original Catalogo mistake | Double   Number category |   | Cico-Nr. /with combined double Nr. | Cico-Nr. / Original  (as on fiche   header) | Total   Number of Works | Shot List   Fiche |   | DCL Nr
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
3215-3 | 3245 / 3247 | Jacutius,   Matthaeus | Matthaei Jacvtii   ... Christianarvm Antiqvitatvm Specimina | Romae :   Monaldini | 1758 | Cicognara.IV.3215(int.3) |   | identical   edition? | plates in   different order | 3215(3),   3245, 3247 | 3215(3) | 0 | 3215 (3) | ## | 096
3245 | 3215-3 /   3247 | Jacutius,   Matthaeus | [Commentarium in titulum Bonusae et Mennae] Matthaei Jacutii   benedictini congregationis montisvirginis Christanarum antiquitatum | Roma | 1758 | Cicognara.VI.M.3(int.3) | fiche header number was wrongly assigned | identical   edition? |   | 3245, 3247,   3215(3) | [fiched as] 3247  = VI M   3(3) | 0 |   |   | 337
3247 | 3215-3 /   3245 | Jacutius,   Matthaeus | Matthæi Jacvtii   ... Christianarvm Antiqvitatvm Monvmentis Atqve Ineditis Inscriptionibvs   Variis Collvstrantvr | Romæ :   Monaldini | 1758 | Cicognara.IV.3247(int.1) |   | identical   edition? | plates in   different order | 3247, 3245   3215(3) | 3247(1) | 1 |   |   | p02

comments.body:


I'm going to just try running them all.
These are running on lib-proc7 now.
It's because there's a quote in the filename. Working on it.

Just confirmed in staging: making a private collection public propagates that change down to members, making them all public too. So I think this ticket is probably "Should making a collection public make all of its members public?"
@escowles, if it helps:  I looked at my own timeline of events: On Wednesday, May 13 just before 04:24pm (when I pinged Will) I changed the collection record visibility from "Private" to "Open".

figgy.title: I would like OCR to be automatically triggered and embedded in PDFs and/or TIFFS selected for download by patrons.

comments.body: I think we can just tell prawn to embed an invisible text layer. I'll test it now. @kelea99 do we have a set of files that this was requested with?

yes, we do @tpendragon . @escowles already fulfilled the request for the pdfs, but obviously not the embedded OCR.  here is the collection: https://dpul.princeton.edu/slavic/catalog/6h441043b /  https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/d2d488af-2980-4554-a9ef-aacbaf463ec8

The volumes in that collection aren't marked as generating OCR (the MVW is, so I assume they expected it to propagate that downwards, but it doesn't.) That's #2835 

I've got a PR in now to embed OCR into PDFs. It doesn't jump you to the word, but it'll get you to the correct page if you search.
@tpendragon I think that sounds reasonable. @escowles , unless you disagree, I see not problem with this way forward.
👍 that sounds good to me — I agree that embedding the plaintext OCR is fine.

requests.title: [WIP] Update other emails
URLS that create a bad request

comments.body: @mzelesky  This may be one of hte "non-criculating item types" in a circulating location?

I figured it out. There is a setting in Voyager Circulation that has to be checked to allow title-level holds for bibs with no items. However, I am not sure this would be desired behavior. For example, in https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/11395328?mfhd=11089235&source=pulsearch, this holding only has current issues. We would not circulate them to a patron. I am inclined to not allow holds for bibs with no items and have it fall under the hold error workflow. I think Joan needs to weigh in.
